trans-unit.source: Extends design-time behavior for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList"></xref> Web server control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataListDesigner"></xref> class.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList"></xref> control can be resized.
`true` if the data list has templates; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection"></xref> object associated with this designer.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection"></xref> associated with this designer.
Creates a template editing frame using the specified verb.
Rather than using editing frames, use template groups and designer editing regions.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion>.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateEditingVerb"></xref> for which to create the template editing frame.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.ITemplateEditingFrame"></xref> object.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataListDesigner"></xref> object and optionally releases the managed resources.

When `disposing` is `true`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataListDesigner.Dispose%2A> method releases all resources held by the managed objects that this <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataListDesigner> object references.
`true` to release both the managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only the unmanaged resources.
Gets the cached template editing verbs available to the designer.
Rather than using editing frames, use template groups and designer editing regions.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion>.
An array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateEditingVerb"></xref> objects consisting of the cached template editing verbs that are available to the designer.
Gets the HTML used to represent the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList"></xref> control at design time.
The HTML that is used to represent the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList"></xref> control at design time.
Gets the HTML used to represent an empty template-based control at design time.
The HTML used to represent an empty template-based control at design time.
Gets the HTML to display at design time for the specified exception when an error has been encountered while rendering the control.
The exception that occurred.
The HTML displayed at design time for the specified exception.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem.System#Web#UI#IDataItemContainer#DataItem"></xref> property of the template container.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataListDesigner.GetTemplateContainerDataItemProperty%2A> method is obsolete.
To access the template metadata, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition>.
The name of the template.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem.System#Web#UI#IDataItemContainer#DataItem"></xref> property of the container of the template.
Gets the content of the template.
Rather than using editing frames, use template groups and designer editing regions.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion>.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.ITemplateEditingFrame"></xref> instance from which to get the content.
The name of the template.
`true` if the template's content can be edited; `false` if the content is read-only.
The content of the template.
Initializes the designer with the specified component.
The control element being designed.
Called when the data source to which the underlying control is bound loads a new schema.
Override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataListDesigner.OnSchemaRefreshed%2A> method to perform additional actions that might be required when new schema becomes available.
Called when the template editing verbs change.
Rather than using editing verbs, use template groups and designer editing regions.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion>.
Sets the content for the specified template and frame.
Rather than using editing verbs, use template groups and designer editing regions.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion>.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.ITemplateEditingFrame"></xref> instance for which to set the content.
The name of the template.
The new content for the template.
Gets a value indicating whether there are templates defined for the associated control.
`true` if the associated control has templates defined; otherwise `false`.
